Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Minister Dominique Bryant, Victorious Triumphant Word International Church, 2533 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11207.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cumbo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Minister Dominique Bryant.
, Victorious Triumphant Word International Church, 2533 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11207.

Council Member Cumbo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 7, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Miller.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Miller moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 7, 2014 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to city-wide ambient noise level monitoring.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: City-wide ambient noise level monitoring.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fees for the installation of solar power energy systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Fees for the installation of solar power energy systems.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the federal government to continue Medicaid coverage for individuals while they are incarcerated in correctional facilities, including New York City jails.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Continue Medicaid coverage for individuals while they are incarcerated in correctional facilities, including NYC jails.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to strengthening the licensing requirements in the sight-seeing bus industry.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Strengthening the licensing requirements in the sight-seeing bus industry.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in ten business improvement districts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in ten business improvement districts.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the Steinway Street, 34th Street, 125th Street, 47th Street, 86th Street Bay Ridge, Columbus/Amsterdam, Forest Avenue, Myrtle Avenue Brooklyn, 161st Street, and Sunnyside Business Improvement Districts, and the setting of the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Increase in the amount to be expended annually in ten business improvement districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspending alternate side parking regulations and meter parking regulations on September 11 of each year.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Suspending alternate side parking regulations and meter parking regulations on September 11 of each year.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.1485/A.1683, which would authorize the issuance of “Cure Childhood Cancer” license plates and would allocate funds generated to support childhood cancer research
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Authorize the issuance of “Cure Childhood Cancer” license plates. (S.1485/A.1683)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation allowing states and localities to grant disabled veterans access to high-occupancy vehicle lanes without risking the loss of federal highway funds.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Allowing states and localities to grant disabled veterans access to high-occupancy vehicle lanes without risking the loss of federal highway funds.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to alternate side of the street parking.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Alternate side of the street parking.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to solid waste collections.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Solid waste collections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring improved prospective notice of the department of environmental protection sewer connection charge.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring improved prospective notice of the department of environmental protection sewer connection charge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing paid leaves of absence for employees of the city to receive cancer screenings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Authorizing paid leaves of absence for employees of the city to receive cancer screenings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to contemporaneous registration and absentee ballot application.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Contemporaneous registration and absentee ballot application.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of a small business accessibility coordinator
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Designation of a small business accessibility coordinator.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to chokeholds.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Chokeholds

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to publish quarterly and annual reports relating to use of force incidents
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYPD reports relating to use of force incidents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to use of injurious physical force by law enforcement officers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Use of injurious physical force by law enforcement officers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York police department to develop and provide guidance for its officers on obtaining consent to search individuals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Right to Know Act - Requiring the NYPD to develop and provide guidance for its officers on obtaining consent to search individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of traffic calming devices adjacent to senior centers and naturally occurring retirement communities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the installation of traffic calming devices adjacent to senior centers and naturally occurring retirement communities.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the CUNY Board of Trustees to adopt the SUNY Board of Trustees resolution regarding sexual assault prevention and response.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Urging the CUNY Board of Trustees to adopt the SUNY Board of Trustees resolution regarding sexual assault prevention and response.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of orders to correct underlying conditions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Issuance of orders to correct underlying conditions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of wireless communications devices while operating a bicycle.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of wireless communications devices while operating a bicycle.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bicycle safety.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Bicycle Safety

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the installation of energy-efficient street lights.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Installation of energy-efficient street lights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to cultural liaisons.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Cultural liaisons.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to report annually the total number of vacant units in all of its developments, disaggregated by the number of units that are fit and unfit for occupancy, and provide details on the reason why a vacant apartment is deemed unfit for occupancy.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to report annually the total number of vacant units in all of its developments, disaggregated by the number of units that are fit and unfit for occupancy, and provide details on the reason why.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit to the council reports relating to naloxone hydrochloride.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to submit to the council reports relating to naloxone hydrochloride.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the New York city energy conservation code to the New York state energy code with amendments unique to construction in the city and repealing section 28-1001.2 in relation thereto.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Conforming the NYC energy conservation code to the NYS energy code with amendments unique to construction in the city and repealing section 28-1001.2 in relation thereto.

Items.Title: Application No. C 140323(A) ZSQ an application submitted by 2030 Astoria Developers, LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for special permits pursuant to Zoning Resolution: (i) Section 74-743(a)(1) to allow distribution of floor area without regard for zoning lot lines; (ii) Section 74-743(a)(2) to modify requirements of Section 23-711 (Standard minimum distance between buildings), Section 23-47 (Minimum required rear yards), and Section 23-85 (Inner court regulations); and (iii) Section 74-743(a)(6) to modify requirements of Section 23-86 (Minimum distance between legally required windows and walls or lot lines), to facilitate a mixed-use large scale general development on the Halletts Point Peninsula, Borough of Queens, Community District 1, Council District 22.  This application is subject to the review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.AgendaNote: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Rule 11.70(b) of the Rules of the Council and Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Approved with Modifications and Referred to the City Planning Commission pursuant to Section 197-(d) of the New York City Charter.

Items.MatterName: Zoning, ASTORIA COVE DEVELOPMENT, Queens (C 140323(A) ZSQ)

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, November 25, 2014.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).
